body_html: I think the .__init__() method would be the right place for these checks if we decide to perform them always, but I worry that this would cause significant performance overhead, especially since we consider distributions to be flyweight objects that merely wrap methods. Maybe we could add a new method .validate() to do this expensive validation logic?

body: I think the `.__init__()` method would be the right place for these checks if we decide to perform them always, but I worry that this would cause significant performance overhead, especially since we consider distributions to be flyweight objects that merely wrap methods. Maybe we could add a new method `.validate()` to do this expensive validation logic?
